result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob Michael Lach-Cook

defendant.name: Lach-Cook, Jacob Michael
defendant.address: 7940 South Wildwood Drive  #4, Oak Creek, WI 53154

records.addlTxt: Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION; all other previously ordered terms and conditions of bail to continue.

Defendant Jacob Michael Lach-Cook in court, in custody.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Jacob Michael Lach-Cook.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for return on warrant. Court hears arguments as to bail. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court orders signature bond sets at $1500.00; Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 3 SUPERVISION.  All other previously ordered terms and conditions of bail to continue. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 36. Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 10/15/2022.  Original bench warrant in file. Case is adjourned until 10/20/2022 for Return on Bench Warrant in Branch 36.  Notice is given to Public Defender's Office and District Attorney.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($1,500.00 signature bond) LW

Defendant Jacob Michael Lach-Cook not in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Jacob Michael Lach-Cook.  Prosecuting attorney Katherine Seelow for Samuel Simpson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued with REMAND TO JUDGE upon return of the bench warrant. Court orders forfeiture of bail.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Jacob Michael Lach-Cook in court with Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 36.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Attorney Haley Wentz
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 07/28/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with  SLG.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jacob Michael Lach-Cook in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/26/22 @ 2:30p
